alert.note: Alert for Brewster (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 11:48PM CDT until May 27 at 7:52PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande at Castolon affecting Brewster County. Rio Grande at Johnson Ranch affecting Brewster County. For the Rio Grande...including Castolon, Johnson Ranch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Castolon. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet (4.0 meters), the river reaches bankfull, and no significant damage is expected. At 15.0 feet (4.6 meters), the river reaches minor flood stage, and lowland flooding begins. The river begins to flood the road between Santa Elena Canyon and Cottonwood Campground in Big Bend National Park. The river begins to flood the parking lot at Santa Elena Canyon, and cut off the nature trail into the canyon. Campers in Cottonwood Campground need to prepare for possible evacuations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 7.3 feet (2.2 meters). - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.2 feet (4.6 meters) tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet (4.6 meters). - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Fri Fri Fri Fri Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1am 7am 1pm 7pm Rio Grande Castolon 15.0 7.3 Thu 11pm 10.8 15.2 11.4 4.2 Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (meters): Fld Observed Fri Fri Fri Fri Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1am 7am 1pm 7pm Rio Grande Castolon 4.6 2.2 Thu 11pm 3.3 4.6 3.5 1.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 1200 PM CDT.
